abstract: Supreme Court hears case concerning whether firms saying false but harmless things about consumers on Internet can be sued under Fair Credit Reporting Act; Spokeo posted erroneous profile of Thomas Robins.
lead_paragraph: The case against the personal data Internet firm Spokeo involves an online profile of a man that was riddled with errors.

headline.main: Justices Hear Debate on Suing Companies for Seemingly Harmless Falsehoods
headline.print_headline: Court Debates Suing Firms for Inoffensive Falsehoods

snippet: The case against the personal data Internet firm Spokeo involves an online profile of a man that was riddled with errors.
